alert.note: Alert for Pryor, Northern Bighorn Mountains; Southeastern Carbon (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 3:29PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Carbon County through 400 PM MDT... At 329 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Frannie, or 16 miles north of Powell. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Warren. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for south central Montana.

area.areaDesc: Pryor, Northern Bighorn Mountains; Southeastern Carbon
